item.title: Project Setup
item.description: Purpose: To get hands-on experience with the implementation of universal rendering. In this lab, we will clone down a client-side rendered application from Github and convert it to leverage universal rendering.

item.title: Step 1: Create a route handler
item.description: First, we need to create a route handler with Express so that we can build the document dynamically, rather than serving a static index.

item.title: Step 2: Render the App markup to a string
item.description: In the request handler that we just created, there is a portion of the string where we define the “root” element of our application: <div id="root"></div>.

item.title: Step 3: Call the API from the server to fetch data for the app
item.description: The markets aren’t getting populated because the function componentDidMount() in src/client/components/MarketList.jsx doesn’t ever get called when our app is rendered via renderToString.

item.title: Step 4: Attach event listeners in the client
item.description: Nothing happens when we click the “right” arrow in our application because we haven’t attached any event listeners in the client.

item.title: Step 5: Pass data from the server to the client
item.description: One way that we can pass data from the server to the client is by serializing it (parsing it into a string) and including it in the response that we send to the client.

item.title: Step 6: Measure performance
item.description: Using the skills that we acquired in the gathering metrics lesson, let’s measure the FCP and FMP of our application now that we have implemented universal rendering.

item.title: Bonus
item.description: We finished early! Is there anything else that we can do to improve the performance of our application?
